title: Representing SHM - compare time and maximum speed

content.description: System <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and System <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> each consist of a block attached to a compressed horizontal spring, as shown. In both systems, the spring is compressed by the same distance and the block is released from rest, undergoing simple harmonic motion. The period of the block in System <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is <math alttext="uppercase T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and the period of the block in System <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is <math alttext="uppercase T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase T sub 1 is greater than uppercase T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The block in System <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> takes time <math alttext="lowercase t sub 1 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to reach its maximum speed <math alttext="v sub 1 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>, and the block in System <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes time <math alttext="lowercase t sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to reach its maximum speed <math alttext="v sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lowercase t sub 1 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="lowercase t sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="v sub 1 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="v sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: Time to reach maximum speedMaximum speedA<math alttext="lowercase t sub 1 comma max is less than lowercase t sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="v sub 1 comma max is less than v sub 2 comma max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
